jesusChrist.title: Jesus Christ
jesusChrist.subtitle: Our Savior, Redeemer, and the central figure of our faith

whoIs.title: Who is Jesus Christ?
whoIs.p1: Jesus Christ is the Son of God, the Savior and Redeemer of the world. He is the central figure of our faith and the foundation of our hope. Through His infinite Atonement, all mankind may be saved by obedience to the laws and ordinances of the Gospel.
whoIs.p2: We believe that Jesus Christ is the literal Son of God, born of Mary in Bethlehem. He lived a perfect, sinless life, showing us the way to live and serve others. His teachings, miracles, and example provide the pattern for our lives.

atonement.title: The Atonement of Jesus Christ
atonement.p1: The Atonement of Jesus Christ is the central doctrine of our faith. Through His suffering in Gethsemane and His death on the cross, Jesus Christ took upon Himself the sins, pains, and afflictions of all mankind. This infinite sacrifice makes it possible for us to be forgiven of our sins and return to live with our Heavenly Father.
atonement.scripture: For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have everlasting life.
atonement.p2: The Atonement not only provides forgiveness for our sins but also gives us strength to overcome our weaknesses and challenges. Through His grace, we can become better people and draw closer to God.

following.title: Following Christ's Example
following.p1: As followers of Jesus Christ, we strive to live as He lived. This means loving God with all our heart, might, mind, and strength, and loving our neighbors as ourselves. We seek to serve others, show compassion, and live with integrity and faith.
following.p2: Christ taught us to be humble, forgiving, and charitable. He showed us how to pray, how to treat others with kindness, and how to trust in our Heavenly Father's plan. By following His example, we can find peace, joy, and purpose in our lives.

relationship.title: Our Relationship with Christ
relationship.p1: Jesus Christ is not just a historical figure to us—He is our living Savior. We believe He knows each of us personally and loves us unconditionally. Through prayer, scripture study, and following His teachings, we can develop a personal relationship with Him.
relationship.p2: As we come unto Christ, we find healing, hope, and direction for our lives. He is our advocate with the Father and our source of strength in times of trial. Through His Atonement, we can be transformed and become more like Him.

whatIs.title: What is the Book of Mormon?
whatIs.p1: The Book of Mormon is another testament of Jesus Christ, confirming the truths found in the Bible. It is a sacred record of ancient American civilizations and contains the fullness of the everlasting gospel. The book was written by ancient prophets who lived on the American continent from approximately 600 B.C. to A.D. 421.
whatIs.p2: The Book of Mormon testifies of Jesus Christ and His divine mission. It teaches the same principles of faith, repentance, baptism, and the gift of the Holy Ghost that are found in the Bible. Together, the Bible and the Book of Mormon provide a more complete understanding of God's plan for His children.

comingForth.title: The Coming Forth of the Book of Mormon
comingForth.p1: The Book of Mormon was translated by Joseph Smith through the gift and power of God. The original records were written on gold plates and were buried in the earth for over 1,400 years. In 1823, the angel Moroni appeared to Joseph Smith and told him about these sacred records.
comingForth.scripture: And he shall bring forth a new record, and therein shall be the same gospel which he hath declared unto them in the Bible; and there shall be no more than two nations.
comingForth.p2: After four years of preparation, Joseph Smith received the gold plates and translated them by the power of God. The Book of Mormon was first published in 1830 and has since been translated into over 100 languages.

teachings.title: Key Teachings of the Book of Mormon
teachings.p1: The Book of Mormon contains many important teachings about Jesus Christ, including His birth, ministry, death, and resurrection. It teaches about the importance of faith, repentance, baptism, and receiving the gift of the Holy Ghost. The book also emphasizes the importance of families, service to others, and following the commandments of God.
teachings.p2: One of the most powerful teachings in the Book of Mormon is about the Atonement of Jesus Christ. The book teaches that through Christ's sacrifice, all mankind can be saved and return to live with God. It also teaches about the importance of personal revelation and how we can receive guidance from God in our daily lives.

promise.title: The Promise of the Book of Mormon
promise.p1: The Book of Mormon contains a promise that anyone who reads it with a sincere heart and asks God in faith will receive a witness of its truthfulness. This promise is found in Moroni 10:3-5, where we are invited to read, ponder, and pray about the book.
promise.scripture: And when ye shall receive these things, I would exhort you that ye would ask God, the Eternal Father, in the name of Christ, if these things are not true; and if ye shall ask with a sincere heart, with real intent, having faith in Christ, he will manifest the truth of it unto you, by the power of the Holy Ghost.
promise.p2: This promise applies to everyone who reads the Book of Mormon. Through prayer and study, we can receive a personal witness that the book is true and that it contains the word of God.

study.title: How to Study the Book of Mormon
study.p1: The Book of Mormon is meant to be studied prayerfully and regularly. We encourage everyone to read it daily, ponder its teachings, and apply its principles in their lives. The book can be read individually or as a family, and there are many resources available to help with understanding its teachings.
study.p2: As you study the Book of Mormon, look for principles that apply to your life. Pay attention to the examples of faith, courage, and obedience shown by the people in the book. Most importantly, pray for understanding and guidance as you read.

divineNature.title: The Divine Nature of Families
divineNature.p1: Families are central to God's plan for His children. We believe that families can be together forever through sacred temple ordinances. The family is the fundamental unit of society and the most important organization in time and eternity. God established families to provide love, support, and guidance for His children.
divineNature.p2: The family is where we learn to love, serve, and care for others. It is where we develop our character, values, and faith. Through family relationships, we experience joy, growth, and the blessings of God's love. The family provides a safe haven where we can learn, grow, and become the people God wants us to be.

templeMarriage.title: Temple Marriage and Eternal Families
templeMarriage.p1: In temples, worthy couples can be sealed together for time and all eternity. This sacred ordinance, performed by proper priesthood authority, binds families together beyond death. When a couple is sealed in the temple, their marriage is not just for this life but for eternity.
templeMarriage.scripture: And I will give unto thee the keys of the kingdom of heaven: and whatsoever thou shalt bind on earth shall be bound in heaven: and whatsoever thou shalt loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven.
templeMarriage.p2: Children born to parents who have been sealed in the temple are automatically sealed to their parents for eternity. This means that families can be together forever, not just until death separates them. This is one of the greatest blessings of the gospel of Jesus Christ.

familyHistory.title: Family History and Temple Work
familyHistory.p1: We believe that all of God's children, both living and dead, should have the opportunity to receive the blessings of the gospel. Through family history research and temple work, we can help our deceased ancestors receive the ordinances of salvation, including baptism, confirmation, and temple sealing.
familyHistory.p2: Family history work connects us to our ancestors and helps us understand our heritage. It strengthens our families and brings us closer to God. When we perform temple ordinances for our ancestors, we are helping them progress in their eternal journey and strengthening the bonds of our eternal family.

strengthening.title: Strengthening Families Today
strengthening.p1: While eternal families are a future blessing, we can begin strengthening our families today. This includes regular family prayer, scripture study, and family home evening. We should also spend quality time together, support each other, and work together to overcome challenges.
strengthening.p2: Strong families are built on principles of love, respect, forgiveness, and service. Parents should teach their children the gospel and help them develop faith in Jesus Christ. Children should honor and obey their parents. When families work together and support each other, they become stronger and more united.

promise.title: The Promise of Eternal Families
promise.p1: The promise of eternal families gives us hope and comfort in times of loss and separation. We know that death is not the end of our relationships with our loved ones. Through the Atonement of Jesus Christ and the power of the priesthood, families can be reunited and live together forever in the presence of God.
promise.scripture: And if it so be that you should labor all your days in crying repentance unto this people, and bring, save it be one soul unto me, how great shall be your joy with him in the kingdom of my Father!
promise.p2: This promise motivates us to live righteously and to work towards being worthy of eternal life. It encourages us to strengthen our family relationships and to help others come unto Christ. The family is not just a temporary arrangement but an eternal institution that will continue forever.

livingProphets.title: Living Prophets
livingProphets.subtitle: God Speaks Through His Chosen Servants

whatIs.title: What is a Prophet?
whatIs.p1: A prophet is a man called by God to be His spokesman on earth. Prophets receive revelation from God and teach His will to the people. They are chosen by God to lead His church and to guide His children in righteousness. Throughout history, God has called prophets to teach His gospel and to warn His people.
whatIs.p2: Prophets are not perfect men, but they are called of God and sustained by the people. They receive inspiration and revelation to guide the church and to help God's children navigate the challenges of their time. They speak for God and provide direction for our lives.

modernRevelation.title: Modern-Day Revelation
modernRevelation.p1: We believe that God continues to speak to His children today through living prophets. Just as God spoke to Moses, Isaiah, and other ancient prophets, He speaks to His prophets today. This modern revelation helps us understand God's will for our time and provides guidance for the challenges we face.
modernRevelation.scripture: Surely the Lord God will do nothing, but he revealeth his secret unto his servants the prophets.
modernRevelation.p2: Modern revelation comes through the President of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, who serves as the prophet, seer, and revelator for the entire world. This revelation is given in general conference addresses, official statements, and other inspired communications.

firstPresidency.title: The First Presidency and Quorum of the Twelve
firstPresidency.p1: The First Presidency consists of the President of the Church and his two counselors. The Quorum of the Twelve Apostles are special witnesses of Jesus Christ and serve under the direction of the First Presidency. Together, these fifteen men form the governing body of the church and receive revelation for the entire world.
firstPresidency.p2: These men are called of God and sustained by the members of the church. They travel throughout the world to teach, testify, and minister to God's children. They provide guidance on matters of doctrine, policy, and personal conduct. Their teachings help us understand God's will and live according to His commandments.

generalConference.title: General Conference
generalConference.p1: Twice a year, the church holds general conference, where the prophet and other church leaders speak to the entire world. These conferences are broadcast worldwide and provide an opportunity for all members to hear the word of God through His chosen servants. The messages given in general conference are considered scripture and provide guidance for our lives.
generalConference.p2: General conference addresses cover a wide range of topics, including faith, repentance, service, family, and current challenges facing the world. These messages provide comfort, guidance, and direction for members of the church and anyone who chooses to listen. They help us understand how to apply gospel principles in our daily lives.

following.title: Following the Prophet
following.p1: We are encouraged to follow the counsel of the living prophets. Their teachings help us stay on the path that leads to eternal life. When we follow their guidance, we are blessed with peace, protection, and spiritual growth. The prophet's words are not just suggestions but are inspired guidance from God.
following.scripture: Whether by mine own voice or by the voice of my servants, it is the same.
following.p2: Following the prophet requires faith and obedience. We may not always understand why certain counsel is given, but we can trust that it comes from God and is for our benefit. As we follow the prophet's guidance, we will be blessed and protected from the evils of the world.

baptism.title: Baptism
baptism.subtitle: The First Principles and Ordinances of the Gospel

faith.title: Faith in Jesus Christ
faith.p1: Faith is the first principle of the gospel. It is a hope for things which are not seen, but which are true. Faith in Jesus Christ means trusting in Him, believing in His teachings, and following His example. When we have faith in Christ, we accept Him as our Savior and Redeemer and believe that through His Atonement, we can be forgiven of our sins and return to live with God.
faith.scripture: And now as I said concerning faith—faith is not to have a perfect knowledge of things; therefore if ye have faith ye hope for things which are not seen, which are true.
faith.p2: Faith leads us to act. When we have faith in Jesus Christ, we are willing to keep His commandments, repent of our sins, and follow His teachings. Faith is like a seed—when we plant it and nourish it, it grows and brings forth good fruit in our lives.

repentance.title: Repentance
repentance.p1: Repentance is the second principle of the gospel. It is the process of changing our thoughts, beliefs, and behaviors to align with God's will. Through repentance, we turn away from sin and turn toward God. Repentance involves recognizing our mistakes, feeling sorrow for them, confessing them to God, making restitution when possible, and committing to change.
repentance.scripture: By this ye may know if a man repenteth of his sins—behold, he will confess them and forsake them.
repentance.p2: Repentance is made possible through the Atonement of Jesus Christ. When we repent, we can be forgiven of our sins and receive peace and joy. Repentance is not a one-time event but a continuous process throughout our lives as we strive to become more like Christ.

baptism.title: Baptism
baptism.p1: Baptism is the first ordinance of the gospel and is essential for salvation. It is performed by immersion in water by someone who has the proper priesthood authority. Baptism represents the death, burial, and resurrection of Jesus Christ and symbolizes our commitment to follow Him. When we are baptized, we make a covenant with God to take upon ourselves the name of Jesus Christ, always remember Him, and keep His commandments.
baptism.scripture: And now, if the Lamb of God, he being holy, should have need to be baptized by water, to fulfil all righteousness, O then, how much more need have we, being unholy, to be baptized, yea, even by water!
baptism.p2: Baptism is the gateway to the path that leads to eternal life. Through baptism, we are cleansed from our sins and become members of Christ's church. We are baptized at the age of accountability (eight years old) or when we are old enough to understand and make this important covenant with God.

holyghost.title: The Gift of the Holy Ghost
holyghost.p1: After baptism, we receive the gift of the Holy Ghost through the laying on of hands by those with priesthood authority. The Holy Ghost is the third member of the Godhead and serves as a constant companion, guide, and comforter. The gift of the Holy Ghost is different from the influence of the Holy Ghost—it is the right to have the Holy Ghost as a constant companion, as long as we remain worthy.
holyghost.scripture: And by the power of the Holy Ghost ye may know the truth of all things.
holyghost.p2: The Holy Ghost helps us in many ways: He testifies of truth, warns us of danger, comforts us in times of need, guides us in making decisions, and helps us understand the scriptures. When we live righteously and keep the commandments, we can have the constant companionship of the Holy Ghost, which brings peace, joy, and spiritual strength.

endure.title: Enduring to the End
endure.p1: Enduring to the end means remaining faithful to the covenants we make throughout our lives. It means continuing to have faith in Jesus Christ, repenting daily, keeping the commandments, and serving others. Enduring to the end is not just about surviving—it is about growing, learning, and becoming more like our Savior.
endure.scripture: Look unto me in every thought; doubt not, fear not. Behold the wounds which pierced my side, and also the prints of the nails in my hands and feet; be faithful, keep my commandments, and ye shall inherit the kingdom of heaven.
endure.p2: The gospel of Jesus Christ is a way of life, not just a one-time event. As we endure to the end, we continue to grow spiritually, serve others, and draw closer to God. Through the Atonement of Jesus Christ and our faithfulness, we can receive the greatest of all the gifts of God—eternal life.

planOfSalvation.title: Plan of Salvation
planOfSalvation.subtitle: God's Eternal Plan for His Children

whatIs.title: What is the Plan of Salvation?
whatIs.p1: The Plan of Salvation is God's eternal plan for the happiness and salvation of His children. It explains our purpose in life, where we came from, why we are here, and where we are going after death. This plan was established before the world was created and provides the framework for our eternal progression.
whatIs.p2: The plan includes three main phases: pre-mortal life, mortal life, and life after death. Each phase is essential for our eternal development and happiness. Through this plan, we can become like our Heavenly Father and live with Him forever in eternal families.

preMortal.title: Pre-Mortal Life
preMortal.p1: Before we were born on earth, we lived with our Heavenly Father as His spirit children. We were created in His image and had the potential to become like Him. In this pre-mortal existence, we learned about God's plan and chose to come to earth to gain physical bodies and experience mortality.
preMortal.scripture: Before I formed thee in the belly I knew thee; and before thou camest forth out of the womb I sanctified thee, and I ordained thee a prophet unto the nations.
preMortal.p2: In the pre-mortal life, we developed our personalities, talents, and spiritual gifts. We also made choices that influenced our earthly experiences. This pre-mortal existence helps explain why we have different circumstances and challenges in this life.

mortal.title: Mortal Life
mortal.p1: Mortal life is a time of testing and growth. We are here to gain physical bodies, learn to choose between good and evil, and develop faith in Jesus Christ. This life is not easy, but it is essential for our eternal progression. Through our experiences, we learn to become more like our Heavenly Father.
mortal.p2: During mortality, we face challenges, make mistakes, and experience both joy and sorrow. These experiences help us develop character, compassion, and wisdom. We also have the opportunity to learn about the gospel, make covenants with God, and serve others. The choices we make in this life determine our eternal destiny.

afterDeath.title: Life After Death
afterDeath.p1: After death, our spirits go to the spirit world, where we continue to learn and grow. The spirit world is divided into paradise and prison, based on our acceptance of the gospel during mortality. Those who accepted the gospel go to paradise, while those who did not go to prison, where they can still learn about the gospel.
afterDeath.p2: Eventually, all people will be resurrected and judged according to their works and desires. Based on our choices and faithfulness, we will be assigned to one of three kingdoms of glory: the celestial kingdom (the highest), the terrestrial kingdom, or the telestial kingdom. The celestial kingdom is where we can live with God and our families forever.

atonement.title: The Atonement of Jesus Christ
atonement.p1: Central to the Plan of Salvation is the Atonement of Jesus Christ. Through His suffering, death, and resurrection, Jesus Christ made it possible for us to overcome sin and death. His Atonement provides the way for us to return to our Heavenly Father and receive eternal life.
atonement.scripture: For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have everlasting life.
atonement.p2: The Atonement is not just about forgiveness of sins, but also about enabling us to become better people. Through Christ's grace, we can overcome our weaknesses, develop Christlike attributes, and progress toward eternal life. The Atonement makes the Plan of Salvation possible.

ourRole.title: Our Role in the Plan
ourRole.p1: We have an important role to play in the Plan of Salvation. We must choose to follow Jesus Christ, keep His commandments, and serve others. We should strive to develop faith, repent of our sins, be baptized, receive the gift of the Holy Ghost, and endure to the end. These are the principles and ordinances of the gospel.
ourRole.p2: We also have a responsibility to help others understand and accept the plan. This includes sharing the gospel with our friends and family, serving in the church, and being examples of righteousness. As we help others come unto Christ, we are participating in God's work and helping to fulfill His plan.
